H0.text: what type of government did soviet union have. Authoritarian Regime

H1.text: what type of government did soviet union have. Totalitarian State

H2.text: what type of government did soviet union have. Socialist Republic

H3.text: what type of government did soviet union have. Communist state

A4.text: The Soviet Union was a totalitarian state from 1927 until 1953

A5.text: The Soviet Union was a one-party state until 1990

A7.text: Eric Hobsbawm wrote that although Stalin indeed wanted to achieve total control of the population, he did not establish an actual totalitarian system

A8.text: the historians argue that the main characteristics of the concept – total control over society, total mobilization of the masses, and a monolithic centralized character of the regime – were never achieved by the dictatorships called totalitarian

A9.text: A people's republic is a type of communist state with a republican constitution

A10.text: Communist states categorised themselves as socialist state after having reached a specific point of social development
